author: Special Correspondent
text:
‘Unidentified people’ illuminate portrait of CM and name board of park

The district police have registered the first case for violation of Model Code of Conduct (MMC) for the May 16 Assembly elections when a group of ‘unidentified people’ illuminated the portrait of Chief Minister Jayalalithaa and the name board of a park, which read ‘Amma Poonga’, here on Saturday evening.

After receiving a complaint in this regard, District Election Officer and Collector S. Natarajan deployed a team of officials, who inspected and covered thåe name board, installed at the entrance of the park near government employees’ quarters at D Block, coming under Tiruvadanai Assembly constituency.

The police said that soon after the MCC came into force on Friday officials covered the Chief Minister’s portrait and the name board installed at the park, but some ‘unknown people’ suspected to be the volunteers of the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK), removed the cover and illuminated the portrait and the name board.

Acting on a complaint by Ravi, Block Development Officer, Kenikarai police registered a case under Section 4 (A) of the Tamil Nadu Open Places (Prevention of Disfigurement) Act, 1959, and launched an investigation.
title: First poll code violation case in Ramanathapuram
